"...dum loquimur, fugerit invida aetas: carpe diem, quam minimum credula postero." As we speak cruel time is fleeing. Seize the day, believing as little as possible in the morrow. — Horace, Odes (c. 23 BC and 13 BC), Book I, ode xi, line 8.
